intro: Commersonia crispa var. minor, commonly known as the slender commersonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
